intro: Oxydectes hancei, commonly known as the Hance's oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
